sub_topic: Identifying the hybridization of an atom in a molecule
message_1: What is the hybridization of the nitrogen atom in ammonia (NH3)?
message_2: The hybridization of the nitrogen atom in ammonia (NH3) is sp3. In ammonia, the nitrogen atom has one lone pair and three single bonds with three hydrogen atoms. This gives it a total of four electron domains, which corresponds to sp3 hybridization.
